results.title: Comparison of Dual Therapies for Lowering Blood Pressure in Black Africans.
results.text_hl: Among the 621 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who underwent 24-hour blood-@<m>DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ monitoring at baseline and at 6 months, those receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ and those receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ had a lower 24-hour ambulatory systolic blood @<m>DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ than those receiving @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ (between-group difference in the change from baseline, -3.14 mm Hg; 95% confidence interval [CI], -5.90 to -0.38; P = 0.03; and -3.00 mm Hg; 95% CI, -5.8 to -0.20; P = 0.04, respectively).
